concept.title: NCC platform alarms
concept.shortdesc: The NCC platform has many alarms configured out-of-box.

section.title: Overview
section.p:
The NCC platform alarms are the following:
CDR alarms
Data Refinery alarms
Local system monitoring alarms
Network monitoring alarms
Other platform alarms
NCC Telemetry alarms (optional)

section.title: Data Refinery alarms
section.p: For information on alarms generated by Data Refinery, see Data Refinery Reference Manual.

row.entry: Field mapping list was empty, disabling field name mapping.
Make sure CG Configuration Node is scheduled at least once.
Error occured xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
An unknown error has occured. The explanation provides more details about the problem.
Redis command execution error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
Redis command execution failed. Check the log for more details.
Mapper queue size is above threshold.

entry.p: There are not enough Business logic streams to handle the collected input records. More Business logic streams need to be instantiated.
The threshold configured in CG Kafka Node with node parameter QueueSizeLowThreshold has been reached.

row.entry: Mapper queue size is back below threshold.
Business logic stream is able to handle the collected input records again. Queue size is back to below or equal to the value of node parameter QueueSizeClearThreshold in CG Kafka Node.
Output stream queue size is above threshold.

entry.p: There are not enough Output streams to handle the collected input records. More Output streams need to be instantiated.
The threshold configured in CG Mapper Node with node parameter QueueSizeLowThreshold has been reached.

row.entry: Output stream queue size is back below threshold.
Output stream is able to handle the collected input records again. Queue size is back to below or equal to the value of node parameter QueueSizeClearThreshold in CG Mapper Node.
Database utilization percentage is above threshold.

entry.p: The threshold configured in CG Kafka Node with node parameter DatabaseUsageLowThreshold has been reached.

row.entry: Database utilization percentage is back to below threshold.
Database usage percentage is back to below or equal to the value of node parameter DatabaseUsageClearThreshold in CG Kafka Node.
Full rejection of incoming records due to xxx.

entry.p: Kafka input stream has paused the collection of input records. This happens when any of database usage, Business logic stream queue size or Output stream queue size exceeds the defined high threshold.
The high thresholds are configured with node parameters DatabaseUsageHighThreshold or QueueSizeHighThreshold in CG Kafka Node and CG Mapper Node.

row.entry: Full rejection of incoming records has stopped.

entry.p: Database usage, Business logic stream queue size and Output stream queue size have all fallen below the defined low thresholds and Kafka input stream is no longer pausing the collection.
The low thresholds are configured with node parameters DatabaseUsageLowThreshold or QueueSizLowThreshold in CG Kafka Node and CG Mapper Node.

row.entry: Decoding error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
The node received an unexpected message from the Kafka topic that could not be decoded.
Error occurred xxx time(s) while connected to the Kafka broker: xxx
An unexpected error occurred while connected to the Kafka broker, more information about the error in logs.
Error occurred xxx time(s) while committing the message to Kafka: xxx
The received message could not be committed to Kafka after multiple attempts. The message will be reprocessed.
Missing CDR session information fields (error occurred xxx time(s)): xxx
The received CDR message did not have the required fields (sessionId, sequence number) to be stored into Redis. It will be treated as an EDR.
Error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: detected xxx failed Kafka consumer thread(s). Check connectivity towards Redis as well as node internal storage logs.
At least one Kafka consumer thread was unexpectedly terminated.
Failed to query database size limit:xxx
Error occurred when querying database size limit.
Kafka consumer lag (current value: <lag>) is above the low level threshold. Consider increasing the number of input steams.
Alarm for informing that the Kafka consumer lag passed the low level threshold.
Kafka consumer lag (current value: <lag>) is above the high level threshold. Increase the number of input steams.
Alarm for informing that the Kafka consumer lag passed the high level threshold.
Kafka consumer lag (current value: <lag>) is now below the clear level threshold.
Alarm for informing that the Kafka consumer lag is within the expected boundaries after raising an alarm for too high load.
Failed to query the Kafka consumer lag: <error>
Error occurred when querying the Kafka consumer lag.
Field mapping list was empty, disabling field name mapping.
Make sure CG Configuration Node is scheduled at least once.
Connection to Redis server ‘xxx’ failed. Error:xxx
Make sure that your Redis server is up and running.
Unable to instantiate custom MappingTransformer: xxx
Check the value of node parameter CustomMapperClass .
Unable to instantiate CustomPartialCheckerClass, disabling partial handling. The exception was: xxx
Check the value of node parameter CustomPartialCheckerClass .
There is some problem with Redis itself or in custom mapper class. The explanation provides more details about the problem.
Error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
An unknown error has occurred. The explanation provides more details about the problem.
Error occurred xxx time(s) during mapping: xxx
Mapping of fields failed because of invalid input message. More info about the error in logs.
Connection to Redis server 'xxx' failed. Error: xxx
Make sure that your Redis server is up and running.
Error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
An unknown error has occurred. The explanation provides more details about the problem.
Connection to Data Refinery database ‘xx’ failed. Error: xxx
Make sure that the database parameters have been set correctly.
Data Refinery database execution error. Error: xxx
An error occurred while trying to execute SQL query, see error message for more details..
Number of files in stream link buffers exceeded the configured limit, pausing collection. Limit was: xxx, the maximum number of files in a link buffer was: xxx.

entry.p: At least one of the link buffers in the stream contains more than the allowed number of files.
Check that all nodes are running properly. Once the buffers are empty, collection will start normally again.

row.entry: Link buffers are empty, collection started again.
All stream link buffers are empty, collection will work normally again.
Connection to Redis server ‘xxx’ failed. Error: xxx
Make sure that your Redis server is up and running.
Unable to instantiate custom configuration class: xxx
Make sure that parameter CustomConfigurationClass is correctly set.
Connection to Data Refinery database ‘xxx’ failed. Error: xxx
Make sure the database parameters have been set correctly. Check the error message to help determine the problem.
Error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
An error occurred while trying to execute SQL query, see error message for more details.
Redis command execution error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
Redis command execution failed. Check the log for more details.
Validation of the latest configuration failed (and is not taken into use). Reason: xxx
Validation of configuration data failed. Check the reasons given and correct the problem before running the node again.
Distribution rules were changed and updated successfully.
Field mapping was changed and updated successfully.
Reading field mapping file failed. Error: xxx
Field name mapping is not found. This probably means that there is something wrong with the CFG package of CG Configuration Node.
Lookup draft tables reverted to currently published state.
Configuration draft tables have been reverted to the state at which they were at previous successful publishing.
Published table xxx will not be visible in the UI, since the draft table is not configured to be a lookup table and therefore not visible in the UI.

The draft table is not configured to be a lookup table and therefore neither the draft nor the published table will be visible in the UI. If the table needs to be visible and editable through the UI, the draft table configuration should be checked, fixed and published again.
Configuration cannot be modified while another configuration update is ongoing. Wait until the other update is finished and schedule the node again.
Another node is holding the configuration lock. The lock will be released after the other update is finished. In case of an irrecoverable error, the lock will expire in 30 seconds.
Error: xxx. The node diagnostic file may contain additional information.
Unknown error occurred, see error message in GUI warning and fix based on that. More info about the error in logs.
Connection to Redis server 'xxx' failed. Error: xxx
Make sure that your Redis server is up and running.
Error occurred xxx time(s) during processing: xxx
An unknown error has occurred. The explanation should provide more details about the problem.
Unable to instantiate custom configuration class: xxx
Make sure that CustomConfigurationClass is correctly set.
Mapper queue size is above threshold.
Alarm for informing that mapper queue size passes above first threshold.
Mapper queue size is back below threshold.
Alarm for informing that Mapper queue size is within the expected boundaries after raising an alarm for too high load.
Output queue size is above threshold.
Alarm for informing that output queue size passes above first threshold.
Output queue size is back below threshold.
Alarm for informing that output queue size is within the expected boundaries after raising an alarm for too high load.
Database utilization percentage is above threshold.
Alarm for informing that database utilization percentage passes above first threshold.
Database utilization percentage is back to below threshold.
Alarm for informing that database utilization percentage is within the expected boundaries after raising an alarm for too high load.
Full rejection of incoming records due to xxx
Alarm for informing that all records are rejected.
Full rejection of incoming records has stopped.
Alarm for informing that full rejection of incoming records has stopped.
Error: xxx. The node diagnostic file may contain additional information.
Unknown error occurred, see error message in GUI warning and fix based on that. More info about the error in logs.
The node finished transferring remote files.
Cannot schedule node execution. Reason: xxx
Node execution cannot be scheduled. Fix the problem described in the message and try again.

section.title: Local system monitoring alarms
section.p:
The following table lists the local system monitoring alarms.All "service down" and "service instance down" alarms have been combined with the other "service down" and "service instance down" alarms into their respective "<Service Name> Service is Down" and "<Service Name> Instance is Down" alarms. For example, "TRSCHEDULER service down" and "TRSCHEDULER service instance down" are now described as part of the <Service Name> Service is Down and <Service Name> Instance is Down alarms in this table.
AutoClear is described in the following tables as being "yes" or "true" or "no" or "false". AutoClear: yes and true mean that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm. AutoClear: no or false means that the alarm must be cleared manually.
section.note: The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of therse tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionsSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

table.title: Local system monitoring alarms (NCC Fastpass mode - NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB)

row.entry: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics

entry.p: AdditionalText: Target system is not in service.
AdditionalText: Target system is in an overload state, <usage_state>. Affected components: [<components>].

row.entry: System in resource critical overload state

entry.p: AdditionalText: Target system is in an overload state, resource critical. Components affected: [<components>].
AdditionalText: This alarm is raised when a diameter message validation error occurs.
AdditionalText: This alarm is raised when a diameter SLF lookup failure occurs.
AdditionalText: Throttling has been applied to Diameter messages.

row.entry:
Component is DownThe component can be the SM or the ME in the AdditionalText. For example, for the ME component, the text will be "ME Component is Down".
If NCC is running in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMibMIB is configured), this single alarm will be raised as two different alarms for each component.

Service is Down
If NCC is running in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured), this single alarm will be raised as different alarms for each service.
The service name in the AdditionalText can be one of:
LOADBALANCER
AEROSPIKE_CLUSTER
CDR
CHARGING
DIAMETERIO
LTM
NOTIFICATION
TRSCHEDULER
KAFKA
PROVISIONING
ROLLBACK
TEM
XDR
SM

Instance is Down
If NCC is running in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured), this single alarm will be raised as different alarms for each service.The service name in the AdditionalText can be one of:
LOADBALANCER
AEROSPIKE_CLUSTER
CDR
CHARGING
DIAMETERIO
LTM
NOTIFICATION
PROVISIONING
ROLLBACK
KAFKA
TRSCHEDULER
TEM
XDR
SM

entry.p: AdditionalText: Service <Service Name> is down on node <Host Id>.

row.entry:
Service has less than N instances in serviceThe service name in the AdditionalText can be any of the following:
CHARGING
SM
PROVISIONING
CDR
NOTIFICATION

entry.p: AdditionalText: There are less than ${nFactor} (out of ${nFactor}+${kFactor}) ${serviceName} instances in service, which may jeopardize the ability to handle a full peak engineered load.

row.entry: NCC Site is Down Temporarily for an SU action

entry.p: AdditionalText: SPS will automatically return to service shortly

row.entry: NCC forced to treat component of another NCC site In Service, as if it had received an In Service heartbeat from the site.

entry.p: AdditionalText: The tool force-remote-site-in-service was used to indicate that a component of the remote site should be treated as In Service, even though heartbeats are not being received.

row.entry: NCC returned to normal heartbeat treatment for a component of another NCC

entry.p: AdditionalText: The tool force-remote-site-in-service was used to clear a component of another SPS that was previously forced In Service by the tool.

row.entry: NCC automatically reset to normal heartbeat treatment for a component of another NCC

entry.p: AdditionalText: The heartbeat service returned to normal operation, as communication has been reliable for the expected period of time.

row.entry: A component of another NCC was determined to be Out Of Service
Diameter communication to another NCC is Down

entry.p: AdditionalText: The DB monitor has detected that data migration is in progress in the local DB cluster

row.entry: Aerospike usable disk resources are low.

ul.li: For minor or major severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of usable disk resources. Aerospike defragmentation is unable to keep up with the current load.
For critical severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of usable disk resources, which are critically low and may result in a stop-writes if the percentage drops below 5%.

entry.p:
AdditionalText: Can be one of:
For minor severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of free memory, which is considered low.
For major severity: Aerospike has only <percentage> of free memory, which is considered very low.
For critical severity: Percentage of free memory capacity is critically low and may result in a stop-writes if the percentage drops below 10%.
AdditionalText: Until cause is reverted, Aerospike will reject all write-requests from other components in the system.

The following table describe the alarms that are raised in generic mode. Generic mode means that the NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured.If NCC is instantiated in Generic mode (NokiaEmsMib MIB is configured), the alarms with Alarm IDs 310404, 310405, 310406 are split into multiple alarms. Alarms raised in Generic mode

section.title: Network monitoring alarms
section.p: The following table lists the network monitoring alarms.
section.note: AutoClear is described in the following tables as being "yes" or "true" or "no" and "false". AutoClear: yes or true means that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm. AutoClear: no or false means that the alarm must be cleared manually.

The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of these tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

row.entry: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics

entry.p: AdditionalText: System has detected a peer connection for <RemoteOriginHost> using protocol <protocol>.
AdditionalText: System has detected a peer disconnect for <RemoteOriginHost> using protocol <protocol>.
AdditionalText: System has detected an SCTP address is available for <RemoteOriginHost>. IP address <ip address>.
AdditionalText: System has detected an SCTP address is unavailable for <RemoteOriginHost>. IP address <ip address>.
AdditionalText: Check contents of the countable event 'Failed Routing Attempts'.

row.entry: APP node unable to connect to remote peer, retry continues to fail.

entry.p: AdditionalText: APP node is unable to connect to <originHost> using protocol <protocol>. If the particular peer is connected with the ME in general, and the alarm does not clear by itself, Nokia recommends to RESTART the AppServer on this APP node, then CLEAR the alarm. If the alarm comes back, contact Nokia support.

row.entry: Heartbeat service on Central Management not started.

entry.p: AdditionalText: It is possible a subsystem was unavailable at startup. Restart the application server on the affected Central Management.

row.entry: Heartbeat missing with member. Component for site still seen as in service.

entry.p: AdditionalText: Heartbeat missing with member. At least one other member we received heartbeats from can see the component of the remote site as in service.

row.entry: Heartbeat missing with member. Treating the component for the remote site as OOS.

entry.p: AdditionalText: All members reporting a heartbeat agree that the component for the remote site is unreachable or OOS. At least one of the reporters is from another location. Treating the component for the remote site as OOS.

row.entry: Heartbeat missing with member. No member from another location responded. Cannot declare component OOS.

entry.p: AdditionalText: The remote site is unreachable or OOS. Only members at this location can be reached by heartbeat. The problem may be with the sites at this location. Treating the component for the remote site by its last known status.

row.entry: Heartbeat missing with member. Treating the site as OOS. (2 locations)

entry.p: AdditionalText: The heartbeat between this site and the remote site is down. Treating the component for the remote site as OOS.

row.entry: Waiting for data to resynchronize from remote sites.

entry.p: AdditionalText: The local site will remain OOS while waiting for data to resynchronize from remote sites.

row.entry: At least one node has detected CLUSTER_DOWN, CLUSTER_INACTIVE, or CLUSTER_WINDOW_SHIP for the remote site state.

entry.p: AdditionalText: System has detected an connectivity state of ${dcState} for remote site '${remoteSite}'.

row.entry: The XDR timelag for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: AdditionalText: The XDR timelag for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${timelag} seconds.

row.entry: XDR. Override for OOS-WFR is enabled.

entry.p: AdditionalText: XDR. Override for OOS-WFR is enabled.

row.entry: XDR. Override for OOS-DRR is enabled.

entry.p: AdditionalText: XDR. Override for OOS-DRR is enabled.

row.entry: The Disaster Recovery procedure is required on these site(s) to re-synchronize their data with this NCC.

entry.p: Additional text: The local site has determined that cross-data-replication is BEHIND or OVERFLOWED while transitioning from OOS to IS. The local site will remain OOS during disaster recovery.

row.entry: The local NCC site XDR is falling behind or has overflowed.

entry.p: Additional text: The local site has determined that cross-data-replication is BEHIND or OVERFLOWED. The system has detected local SPS sync state is in a '${syncState}' state

row.entry: The destination errors for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: AdditionalText: The XDR ship destination error count for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${shipSourceErrorCount}.

row.entry: The source errors for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: AdditionalText: The XDR ship source error count for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${shipSourceErrorCount}.

row.entry: The ship latency average for the remote site exceeds the allowable threshold.

entry.p: AdditionalText: The XDR ship latency average for remote site '${remoteSite}' is ${shipLatencyAverage}.

section.title: Other platform alarms
section.p: The following table lists security alarms, threshold alarms, and the alarms raised for the ETCD cluster.AutoClear is described in the following tables as being "yes" or "true" or "no" or "false". AutoClear: yes or true means that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm. AutoClear: no or false means that the alarm must be cleared manually.The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of these tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

row.entry: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics

entry.p: AdditionalText: Indicates the keepalived component has experienced a failover. This alarm is triggered when the new Master transitions to ACTIVE.
AdditionalText: NTP No response from external time service.
AdditionalText: CHRONY No response from external time service.

row.entry: User account dormant threshold warning - no action taken

entry.p: AdditionalText: A user account has been dormant for an extended time period defined by the WARN_IDLE_LOGINS parameter.

row.entry: User account dormant threshold exceeded - account locked

entry.p: AdditionalText: A user account has been dormant for an extended time period defined by the WARN_IDLE_LOGINS parameter.

row.entry: Excessive authentication failures - user account access disabled

entry.p: AdditionalText: A user account 'log-in' access is being disabled because the MAX_LOGIN_FAILURES threshold was crossed.
AdditionalText: A user account 'log-in' access is being disabled because the MAX_LOGIN_FAILURES threshold was crossed.
AdditionalText: An entry in the node's routing table has been added or removed.
service:rtmon,status:started || service:rtmon,status:stopped || user:%s,service:rtmon,detail:User has attempted to modify IP routing table"

row.entry: User has attempted to modify log

entry.p: AdditionalText: An unauthorized user attempted to modify a security log. This is associated with the default set of audits (specifically those with the log keyword) and is always enabled.

row.entry: User Account File has been modified by user

entry.p: AdditionalText: User or group information files such as group, password or shadow have been opened (associated with the access set of audits and can be enabled at discretion of admin). This alarm is also generated when the config audit key is triggered. Several of these are specified in the default set of audits.
The time or date has been changed (associated with the
time-change set of audits and can be enabled at discretion of

row.entry: User has attempted to access nonpermissible file

entry.p: AdditionalText: User account files have been modified (associated with the identity set of audits and can be enabled at discretion of admin).

row.entry: User has attempted to modify root crontab

entry.p: AdditionalText: The root user cron table has been modified.

row.entry: Security audit logging enabled and started

entry.p: AdditionalText: The watson account logging has been enabled and started.

row.entry: Security audit logging stopped and disabled

entry.p: AdditionalText: The watson account logging has been stopped and disabled.
AdditionalText: An admin has invoked the AuditMgr tool to enable (start) a configured set of audits.
AdditionalText: An admin has invoked the AuditMgr tool to disable (stop) a configured set of audits.

row.entry: Possible Denial of Service Attack Detected

entry.p: AdditionalText: The iptables rule(s) have crossed packet-drop threshold.
Full Reset - restarting iptables packet count tracking || Rule%s
Reset - restarting iptables packet count tracking || Rule%s crossed over threshold of %d packets over %d seconds || Rule%s crossed under threshold of %d packets over %d seconds
AdditionalText: Generated when file system has crossed minor alarm threshold.
AdditionalText: Generated when file system has crossed minor alarm threshold.
AdditionalText: Generated when file system has crossed minor alarm threshold.
AdditionalText: Galera cluster node has failed.
AdditionalText: Local MaxScale access has failed.
AdditionalText: Failed to resolve remote data center MaxScale service.
AdditionalText: Failed to resolve remote data center Master service.
AdditionalText: Inter data center replication lag has exceeded threshold.
AdditionalText: Access to leader-elector container has failed via http://localhost:4040
AdditionalText: Remote data center MaxScale access has failed.
AdditionalText: Remote data center MaxScale shows no Master available.
AdditionalText: Remote data center replication broken.
AdditionalText: Database has gone down and keycloak lost the connectivity.

row.entry: clientStorePath + "Certificate is expiring in " + expiresIn +" days"

entry.p: clientStorePath + "Certificate is expiring in "+ expiresIn + " days

row.entry: clientStorePath + "Certificate is expiring in " + expiresIn + " days"

entry.p: clientStorePath + "Certificate is expiring in "+ expiresIn + " days

section.title: NCC Telemetry alarms (optional)
section.p: The following table lists the alarms associated with the optional NCC telemetry package. These alarms are not available unless the optional NCC telemetry package has been deployed.

row.entry: Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics

entry.p: AdditionalText: DB is unavailable. CALM will be out of service because the alarms is stored in DB. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should handle this quickly.
Database health check failure with error message: <message string>

AdditionalText: RabbitMQ is unavailable. CALM will not receive any alarms from RabbitMQ. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should check the RabbitMQ connection and CALM configuration.
RabbitMQ health check failure with error message: <message string>

AdditionalText: Kafka is unavailable. CALM will not receive any alarms from Kafka. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should check the Kafka connection and CALM configuration.
Kafka health check failure with error message: <message string>

AdditionalText: ETCD is unavailable. CALM will be out of service because the alarms is stored in ETCD. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should handle this quickly.
ETCD health check failure with error code: <error code>, error message: <message string>

AdditionalText: VES connection failure. CALM cannot send the VES event Message to VES. CALM have the retry logic. If this alarm is not clear for a long time, the administrator should check the VES connection and CALM configuration.
Cves agent health check failure with error: <error code>

row.entry: CALM Active Alarm Number Over Threshold

entry.p: AdditionalText: Active Alarm Number is Over the Threshold. CALM have too many active alarms. The administor should check these alarms. Please clear some if necessary.
Database/ETCD table size is <current_alarm_table_size> over the <upper_limit_alarm_size>

AdditionalText: CNOT connection failure. CALM cannot forward alarm notifications to CNOT. CALM has the retry logic. If this alarm is not cleared in a reasonable amount of time, the administrator should check the CNOT connection and CALM configuration.
CNOT health check failure with error message: <message string>
AdditionalText: Found more than <count> active <Interface> Session for the device [<deviceId>] for apn [<apn>].
